com.datastrato.gravitino.rel

Interface SupportsSchemas

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    RelationalCatalog

    public interface SupportsSchemas
    The Catalog interface to support schema operations. If the implemented catalog has schema semantics, it should implement this interface.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Schema alterSchema(NameIdentifier ident, SchemaChange... changes)
      Apply the metadata change to a schema in the catalog.
      Schema createSchema(NameIdentifier ident, java.lang.String comment, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> properties)
      Create a schema in the catalog.
      boolean dropSchema(NameIdentifier ident, boolean cascade)
      Drop a schema from the catalog.
      NameIdentifier[] listSchemas(Namespace namespace)
      List schemas under a namespace.
      Schema loadSchema(NameIdentifier ident)
      Load metadata properties for a schema.
      default boolean schemaExists(NameIdentifier ident)
      Check if a schema exists.

    • Method Detail

      • listSchemas

        NameIdentifier[] listSchemas(Namespace namespace)
                      throws NoSuchCatalogException
        List schemas under a namespace.

        If an entity such as a table, view exists, its parent schemas must also exist and must be returned by this discovery method. For example, if table a.b.t exists, this method invoked as listSchemas(a) must return [a.b] in the result array

        Parameters:
        namespace - The namespace to list.
        Returns:
        An array of schema identifier under the namespace.
        Throws:
        NoSuchCatalogException - If the catalog does not exist.

      • schemaExists

        default boolean schemaExists(NameIdentifier ident)
        Check if a schema exists.

        If an entity such as a table, view exists, its parent namespaces must also exist. For example, if table a.b.t exists, this method invoked as schemaExists(a.b) must return true.

        Parameters:
        ident - The name identifier of the schema.
        Returns:
        True if the schema exists, false otherwise.

      • createSchema

        Schema createSchema(NameIdentifier ident,
                    java.lang.String comment,
                    java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> properties)
             throws NoSuchCatalogException,
                    SchemaAlreadyExistsException
        Create a schema in the catalog.
        Parameters:
        ident - The name identifier of the schema.
        comment - The comment of the schema.
        properties - The properties of the schema.
        Returns:
        The created schema.
        Throws:
        NoSuchCatalogException - If the catalog does not exist.
        SchemaAlreadyExistsException - If the schema already exists.

      • loadSchema

        Schema loadSchema(NameIdentifier ident)
           throws NoSuchSchemaException
        Load metadata properties for a schema.
        Parameters:
        ident - The name identifier of the schema.
        Returns:
        A schema.
        Throws:
        NoSuchSchemaException - If the schema does not exist (optional).

      • alterSchema

        Schema alterSchema(NameIdentifier ident,
                   SchemaChange... changes)
            throws NoSuchSchemaException
        Apply the metadata change to a schema in the catalog.
        Parameters:
        ident - The name identifier of the schema.
        changes - The metadata changes to apply.
        Returns:
        The altered schema.
        Throws:
        NoSuchSchemaException - If the schema does not exist.

      • dropSchema

        boolean dropSchema(NameIdentifier ident,
                   boolean cascade)
            throws NonEmptySchemaException
        Drop a schema from the catalog. If cascade option is true, recursively drop all objects within the schema.

        If the catalog implementation does not support this operation, it may throw UnsupportedOperationException.

        Parameters:
        ident - The name identifier of the schema.
        cascade - If true, recursively drop all objects within the schema.
        Returns:
        True if the schema exists and is dropped successfully, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        NonEmptySchemaException - If the schema is not empty and cascade is false.
